comment.text: Mediates E3-dependent ubiquitination and proteasomal degradation of target proteins, including p53/TP53, P73, HDAC1 and CDKN1B. Preferentially acts on tetrameric p53/TP53. Monoubiquitinates the translesion DNA polymerase POLH. Contributes to the regulation of the cell cycle progression. Increases AR transcription factor activity.

reaction.text: S-ubiquitinyl-[E2 ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme]-L-cysteine + [acceptor protein]-L-lysine = [E2 ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme]-L-cysteine + N(6)-ubiquitinyl-[acceptor protein]-L-lysine.

comment.text: Monomer and homodimer. Interacts with AR, p53/TP53, MDM2, HDAC1, KAT5, PLAG1, PLAGL2, CDKN1B, COPE, UBE2D2 and GORAB/NTKLBP1.
Up-regulated during the S phase of the cell cycle. Expressed at low levels during G phase.
Subject to ubiquitination and proteasomal degradation. Interaction with PLAGL2 or KAT5 enhances protein stability.
No ubiquitin protein ligase activity. Down-regulated in hepatocellular carcinoma.
Gene prediction based on partial mRNA data.

comment.name: Atlas of Genetics and Cytogenetics in Oncology and Haematology

property.value: Expressed in sperm and 250 other tissues
P:positive regulation of proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process
